title: Mojtaba Masoudinejad
text:
Greetings and thank you for visiting my personal webpage. Iâ€™m Mojtaba Masoudinejad (Farsi: Ù…Ø¬ØªØ¨ÛŒ Ù…Ø³Ø¹ÙˆØ¯ÛŒ Ù†Ú˜Ø§Ø¯), sometimes friends and colleagues call me Moji (ğŸ˜„ without an E). Originally hailing from the charming city of Dezfool/Dezful in southwest Iran, Iâ€™ve embarked on a journey thatâ€™s taken me all the way to Germany.
Since the beginning of 2023 I have a role as a senior Machine Learning Engineer at the Bosch Center for Artificial Intelligence in Renningen, a part of the esteemed Robert Bosch GmbH. Before my tenure at Bosch, I dedicated two years as a PostDoc researcher in the DAES team at TU Dortmund University.
In July 2020, I successfully defended my PhD thesis, ending a long journey exploring the nuanced topic of â€œModeling Energy Supply Unit of Ultra-low Power Devices with Indoor Photovoltaic Energy Harvestingâ€. This significant milestone was achieved under the collaborative guidance of Prof.Â Michael ten Hompel and Prof.Â Luca Benini, within the framework of the Collaborative Research Center SFB 876, in collaboration with Fraunhofer IML in Dortmund, Germany. My academic journey commenced with an MSc in Automation and Robotics also from TU Dortmund University in 2011, following a BSc in Electrical Engineering with a major in Control and Systems Engineering from Khaje Nasir Toosi University of Technology, Tehran, Iran, in 2007.
